title: Travels in lands beyond the sea.
author: Linskill, Charles Dorrance.
snippet: We ran by Ratho, Kirkliston, and came to South Queen's Ferry, on the Frith of Forth, where a most stupendous cantilever bridge is being erected, which shall be mentioned later. We went on around, another mile, to Port Edgar and took passage on ferry-boat "John Beaumont" for North Queen's Ferry, in Fifeshire.

title: The modern Athens:
author: Mudie, Robert
snippet: covered with boughs ; boughs too were hung across the street, and showed hke triumphal arches turned topsyturvy, as in sorrow at the departui*e of the King. A small platform was erected at Port Edgar, a place a little to the west of Qucensferry, about which there is some idle tradition of an ideal kingly visit, and deliverance from shipwreck. Thence to Hopetoun House, a distance of about two miles, a road was now made along the margin of the Forth.

title: Travels in lands beyond the sea.
author: Linskill, Charles Dorrance.
snippet: Now our train halts at South Queen's Ferry, and then runs on around one mile to Port Edgar, where a ferry steamer awaits to carry us to North Queen's Ferry, in Fifeshire, beyond the Forth.
